Name: Statue of Unity
Nearest Airport: Statue of Unity Airport, Kevadia (5 km)
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather, clear views)
Accessibility: Well-developed roads, wheelchair accessible, battery-operated vehicles available
Guided Tours: Available in multiple languages, audio guides provided
Nearby Amenities: Restaurants, food courts, souvenir shops, restrooms, tent city accommodation
Special Notes: World's tallest statue at 182m, Unity Glow Garden, River cruise, Jungle Safari available

Name: Gir National Park
Timings: 6:00 AM - 10:00 AM & 3:00 PM - 6:00 PM (Oct-June); Closed Mondays
Best Time to Visit: December to March (cooler weather, better wildlife visibility)
Accessibility: Forest tracks, 4WD vehicles recommended, not wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Mandatory forest guides provided, English and Gujarati speaking
Nearby Amenities: Forest rest houses, cafeterias, eco-shops, interpretive center
Special Notes: Only home to Asiatic lions, advance booking required, photography charges extra

Name: Somnath Temple
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather for temple visits)
Accessibility: Well-maintained roads, stairs to temple, wheelchair access limited
Guided Tours: Local guides available, audio guides in multiple languages
Nearby Amenities: Dharamshala, restaurants, souvenir shops, restrooms
Special Notes: First among 12 Jyotirlingas, sound and light show in evening, beachside location

Name: Rann of Kutch
Best Time to Visit: November to February (Rann Utsav season, full moon nights)
Accessibility: Special vehicles provided, temporary roads during festival
Guided Tours: Cultural programs, camel rides, local craft demonstrations
Parking: Designated parking areas, included in tour packages
Nearby Amenities: Tent accommodation, restaurants, craft villages, cultural centers
Special Notes: World's largest salt desert, Rann Utsav festival, full moon nights spectacular

Name: Sabarmati Ashram
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather for walking)
Accessibility: Well-paved paths, wheelchair accessible, guided walkways
Guided Tours: Available in multiple languages, audio tours provided
Nearby Amenities: Museum shop, cafeteria, library, restrooms
Special Notes: Mahatma Gandhi's residence, Dandi March starting point, spinning wheel demonstrations

Name: Rani ki Vav
Type: UNESCO World Heritage Site / Historical Monument
Best Time to Visit: October to March (cooler weather for exploration)
Accessibility: Steps to descend, not wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: ASI guides available, multilingual support
Nearby Amenities: Information center, restrooms, small shops
Special Notes: 11th-century stepwell, UNESCO World Heritage Site, intricate carvings, flood-lit in evenings

Name: Dwarka Temple
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather), Janmashtami festival
Accessibility: Well-connected roads, temple has stairs, limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Local guides available, English and Hindi support
Nearby Amenities: Dharamshala, restaurants, souvenir shops, restrooms
Special Notes: One of Char Dham pilgrimage sites, Krishna's legendary kingdom, beachside location

Name: Ahmedabad Heritage Walk Area
Timings: Heritage walk: 8:00 AM - 10:00 AM (Sunday to Friday)
Entry Fee: ₹100 per person for guided heritage walk
Best Time to Visit: October to March (comfortable walking weather)
Accessibility: Walking tour, some narrow lanes, limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: Expert heritage guides, English and Gujarati support
Nearby Amenities: Traditional eateries, craft shops, restrooms at major monuments
Special Notes: UNESCO World Heritage City, Pol houses, traditional architecture, street food experiences

Name: Gujarat Science City
Best Time to Visit: Year-round (indoor facility), avoid summer afternoons
Accessibility: Modern infrastructure, wheelchair accessible, elevators available
Guided Tours: Interactive exhibits, educational programs for groups
Nearby Amenities: Food court, gift shop, restrooms, energy park
Special Notes: Largest science center in India, IMAX theater, robotics gallery, space exhibits

Name: Marine National Park
Best Time to Visit: October to March (calm seas, better weather)
Accessibility: Boat access required, not suitable for mobility-impaired visitors
Guided Tours: Marine biologists, local fishermen guides
Parking: Available at jetty points, ₹15 for cars
Nearby Amenities: Basic facilities at jetties, packed lunch recommended
Special Notes: India's first Marine National Park, coral reefs, mangroves, dolphin sightings possible

Name: Champaner-Pavagadh Archaeological Park
Type: UNESCO World Heritage Site / Historical Monument
Timings: Sunrise to Sunset; Kalika Temple: 5:00 AM - 10:00 PM
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather for trekking)
Accessibility: Hill climbing required, ropeway available for temple, moderate trekking
Guided Tours: ASI guides available, local guides for temple trek
Nearby Amenities: Rest house, small eateries, restrooms
Special Notes: UNESCO World Heritage Site, mix of Hindu and Islamic architecture, ropeway to Kalika Temple

Name: Palitana Temples
Best Time to Visit: October to March (cooler weather for climbing)
Accessibility: 3,500 steps climb, doli (palanquin) service available, not wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Local Jain guides available, religious significance explained
Nearby Amenities: Dharamshala, vegetarian restaurants, basic medical aid
Special Notes: Sacred Jain pilgrimage site, 863 temples on Shatrunjaya Hill, no food/water allowed on hill after sunset

Name: Saputara Hill Station
Entry Fee: No entry fee for hill station; Lake garden: ₹10
Best Time to Visit: June to February (monsoon and post-monsoon)
Accessibility: Mountain roads, good connectivity, some attractions wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Local tribal culture tours, nature walks available
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, resorts, restaurants, ropeway, boating
Special Notes: Only hill station in Gujarat, tribal culture, Artist Village, monsoon destination

Name: Adalaj Stepwell
Nearest Railway Station: Kali Gandhi Marg Railway Station (15 km)
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather for exploration)
Accessibility: Steps to descend, not wheelchair accessible, good lighting
Guided Tours: ASI guides available on request, information boards present
Nearby Amenities: Small shops, restrooms, interpretation center
Special Notes: 15th-century Indo-Islamic architecture, five-story stepwell, intricate carvings, natural cooling system

Name: Blackbuck National Park
Best Time to Visit: October to March (wildlife active, pleasant weather)
Accessibility: Safari vehicles available, grassland terrain, wheelchair accessible vehicles on request
Guided Tours: Forest guides mandatory, English and Gujarati support
Parking: Available at entry gate, ₹10 for cars
Nearby Amenities: Forest rest house, basic canteen, restrooms
Special Notes: Largest population of blackbucks in India, harrier eagles, wolf sightings possible

Name: Vadodara (Baroda)
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather for sightseeing)
Accessibility: Well-developed city, most attractions accessible
Guided Tours: City tours available, heritage walks organized
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, restaurants, shopping malls, medical facilities
Special Notes: Cultural capital of Gujarat, Laxmi Vilas Palace, Sayaji Baug, MS University, Baroda Museum

Name: Lothal Archaeological Site
Best Time to Visit: October to March (comfortable weather for site exploration)
Accessibility: Walking required, uneven surfaces, not wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: ASI guides available, museum with detailed explanations
Nearby Amenities: Museum, basic refreshments, restrooms
Special Notes: 4,500-year-old Harappan civilization site, ancient dockyard, bead-making factory, maritime heritage

Name: Girnar Hills
Best Time to Visit: October to March (cooler weather for trekking)
Accessibility: 10,000 steps trek, ropeway available to Ambaji Temple, moderate to difficult trekking
Guided Tours: Local guides available for religious significance
Nearby Amenities: Dharamshala, food stalls, medical aid, restrooms
Special Notes: Five mountain peaks, multiple Jain and Hindu temples, Ropeway to Ambaji Temple, panoramic views

Name: Mandvi Beach
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather, calm seas)
Accessibility: Beach accessible by road, some areas wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Boat rides available, local fishermen guides
Nearby Amenities: Beach resorts, restaurants, water sports, camel rides
Special Notes: White sand beach, Vijay Vilas Palace nearby, water sports activities, ship-building heritage

Name: Nalsarovar Bird Sanctuary
Best Time to Visit: November to February (migratory season)
Accessibility: Observation towers accessible, walking trails, wheelchairs manageable on main paths
Guided Tours: Local boatmen with bird knowledge, binoculars available
Nearby Amenities: Forest rest house, basic canteen, bird watching towers
Special Notes: Largest wetland bird sanctuary in Gujarat, 250+ bird species, flamingo sightings, migratory birds

Name: Little Rann of Kutch (Wild Ass Sanctuary)
Timings: 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM (October to June; closed during monsoons)
Best Time to Visit: October to March (wild ass active, pleasant weather)
Accessibility: 4WD vehicles required, salt flat terrain, not wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Mandatory forest guides, wildlife expertise provided
Parking: Available at entry points, ₹15 for cars
Nearby Amenities: Desert resorts, eco-lodges, basic restaurants
Special Notes: Only home to endangered Asiatic wild ass, largest wildlife sanctuary in India (4,953 sq km), salt flats, flamingo colonies

Name: Modhera Sun Temple
Timings: Sunrise to Sunset; Sound & Light Show: 7:30 PM - 8:30 PM
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather), Makar Sankranti festival
Accessibility: Well-maintained complex, some steps, limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: ASI guides available, audio guides in multiple languages
Nearby Amenities: Interpretation center, cafeteria, souvenir shop, restrooms
Special Notes: 11th-century Sun Temple, no shadow at noon during equinox, intricate stone carvings, Pushkarni (stepped tank)

Name: Diu Island
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather, calm seas)
Accessibility: Bridges connect to mainland, beaches accessible, some heritage sites have stairs
Guided Tours: Local guides for heritage walks, water sports operators
Nearby Amenities: Beach resorts, restaurants, bars, water sports, churches
Special Notes: Portuguese heritage, alcohol permitted, pristine beaches, Diu Fort, St. Paul's Church, water sports hub

Name: Porbandar (Kirti Mandir)
Timings: Kirti Mandir: 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM & 4:00 PM - 7:00 PM
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather)
Accessibility: City location, well-connected roads, wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Local guides for Gandhi heritage sites
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, restaurants, museums, beach, market
Special Notes: Mahatma Gandhi's birthplace, Kirti Mandir (birth house museum), Sudama Temple, coastal town, Porbandar Beach

Name: Bhuj City & Kutch Museum
Timings: Museums: 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM & 3:00 PM - 6:00 PM (closed Wednesdays)
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather for exploration)
Accessibility: City center, most attractions accessible, some heritage sites have steps
Guided Tours: Cultural heritage guides, craft village tours available
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, traditional restaurants, craft markets, hospitals
Special Notes: Earthquake-rebuilt city, oldest museum in Gujarat, Aina Mahal (Hall of Mirrors), traditional handicrafts, gateway to Rann of Kutch

Name: Shoolpaneshwar Wildlife Sanctuary
Best Time to Visit: October to March (wildlife active, river cruise season)
Accessibility: Forest roads, boat access for some areas, moderate trekking required
Guided Tours: Forest guides available, tribal village visits
Parking: Available at entry points, ₹10 for cars
Nearby Amenities: Forest rest house, eco-tourism facilities, tribal crafts center
Special Notes: Narmada River sanctuary, tribal culture, river cruises, sloth bears, leopards, endangered species conservation

Name: Thol Bird Sanctuary
Best Time to Visit: November to February (migratory season)
Accessibility: Observation towers accessible, walking trails, wheelchairs manageable on main paths
Guided Tours: Bird watching guides available, binoculars for rent
Nearby Amenities: Visitor center, basic refreshments, restrooms
Special Notes: Important wetland ecosystem, 320+ bird species recorded, flamingo roosting site, photography paradise

Name: Ambaji Temple
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather), Navratri festival
Accessibility: Temple accessible, ropeway to Gabbar Hill, stairs at main temple
Guided Tours: Religious guides available, pilgrimage group tours
Nearby Amenities: Dharamshala, restaurants, shops, medical facilities
Special Notes: One of 51 Shakti Peethas, Gabbar Hill ropeway, Ambaji Fair, border with Rajasthan

Name: Pavagadh Archaeological Park & Kalika Temple
Type: UNESCO World Heritage Site / Religious Site
Timings: Archaeological Park: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM; Temple: 5:00 AM - 10:00 PM
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather), Navratri
Accessibility: Ropeway available, trekking option (2.5 km), not wheelchair accessible for hill temple
Guided Tours: ASI guides for archaeological sites, religious guides for temple
Parking: Available at base and ropeway station, ₹15 for cars
Nearby Amenities: Restaurants, dharamshala, shops, first aid
Special Notes: UNESCO World Heritage Site, 600m elevation, panoramic views, mix of Hindu-Islamic architecture

Name: Junagadh City & Uparkot Fort
Timings: Fort: Sunrise to Sunset; Museums: 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM & 3:00 PM - 6:00 PM
Best Time to Visit: October to March (pleasant weather for exploration)
Accessibility: Some areas wheelchair accessible, fort has uneven terrain
Guided Tours: Local heritage guides available, historical significance explained
Parking: Available at fort entrance, ₹10 for cars
Nearby Amenities: Hotels, restaurants, markets, hospitals
Special Notes: 2300-year-old fort, stepwells, Buddhist caves, Mahabat Maqbara mausoleum, Edicts of Ashoka
